listitem.para: A comma separated list of options that globally enable internal debug logs. For debug logs of a single connection, see debug=.

note.para: This feature is used by &Libreswan; developers when debugging libreswan internals. The default logs should provide sufficient information to diagnose most configuration and connection problems.

listitem.para:
Below is a select list of debug options (for a complete list ipsec whack --debug help):
updown
Run the &ipsec-updown.8; scripts with set -v -x. Helpful when &ipsec-updown.8; isn't behaving as expected.
routing
Dump connection changes (for instance, routed, up, negotiating, ...) and how they interact with the kernel. Helpful when debugging connection transitions, and corresponding updates to kernel state/policy.
base
In addition to routing, include general debug messages.
cpu-usage
Dump the CPU time consumed as an event is processed. Only recommended when diagnosing performance problems.
refcnt
Dump all changes to all reference counters. Only recommended when tracking down a memory leak.
all
Equivalent to routing/, base, cpu-usage, and refcnt. Recommend using either routing, or base instead.
crypt
Dump changes to reference counters. Only recommended when debugging code making calls into the &NSS; library.
private
Dump the cryptographic material used by the IKE and Child SAs. The format is similar to that expected by tcpdump and wireshark.
tmi
It stands for Too Much Information. Need we say more?
All lines of debugging output are prefixed with "|" to distinguish them from normal diagnostic messages (the the command grep -v -e '|' pluto.log can be used to filter out the debug logs).
